title: Website for Drone Photography by Steve Balogh
description: I designed and created a web application for a client that will be used to raise money for underprivileged middle school students. The purpose of this website is to display drone photos that people can purchase a digital or hard copy of the photo. I used React for front end and Redux for state management. I am working on building a web server to store data and other uses. I used Heroku for deployment. The project is still underway.

title: Rachael Mahar's Portfolio
description: After I left CSEA, I decided to teach myself React. I am currently still going through a couple Udemy courses on React/Redux but wanted to make a simple website to show off my work and get practice using components and states. I used Semantic UI library for styling and it is hosted on Heroku. Check out my GitHub for the source code for this website.

title: Legacy API to Node.js API Conversion
description: The API is used by web applications on CSEA's WordPress website that use member data. The old web API was written using PHP. Each web application is written using PHP scripts that make HTTP requests to the API server and handled by Express routing. The routes are written using asynchronous javascript (async/await) to manipulate data via SQL queries. I used Postman to test and debug the routes. I also worked with and refactored legacy queries using Oracle SQL Developer.

title: CSEA WordPress Website
description: I worked on CSEA's new WordPress website. The WordPress instance is hosted on a Apache Linux server in a MySQL database. I refactored and wrote many old PHP scripts from their old website so they they would work with the new website and the new API. I also worked on making the site responsive, mobile friendly and more user friendly.

title: Manage User and Courses Web App
company: Web Application Development Course taught by Eric Breimer at Siena College
description: I created this web application to practice the skills I was learning during the Web App course I took at Siena. A user is able to join or log in from the landing page to edit, manage their profile and a list of courses they have taken. In addition, there is also admin privilages that can manage the users. I used PHP to retrieve data from a MySQL database and to create reusable HTML markup. I used Bootstrap library for styling and it is hosted on my Professor's server. During this course I learned about the request and response processes, the importance of separating an application's content, presentation, and behavior and how to implement a single integrated application using different languages.

title: Developer CheatSheet
company: Software Engineer Capstone Project at Siena College
description: I worked with 9 other people to create this application for our capstone project. The application is meant to be used by developers to ask programming questions via Slack or an Alexa enabled device and the answer will be delivered to their Slack channel. The software was build for our client, General Electric, but the code remains open source. My role in this project was Scrum Master. As Scrum Master, my duties were to conduct meetings such as Sprint Planning, Tri-Weekly Standups, Sprint Review and Sprint Retrospect. I also made sure any blockers were taken care of.

title: Ticket To Ride
company: Object Oriented Programming Course taught by Darren Lim at Siena College
description: I worked on a team of five people on this project for my OOP course at Siena. The task was to create a digital version of the board game Ticket To Ride where each user attepts to create their own railroad lines. It was written in Java using Swing's JApplet class and Java's MouseListener. My main role in this project was to work on the user interface. I worked with other teammate's code to piece together the game logic and data structures with the images and buttons the user uses to interact with the game.
